thread.title: Southwest section of Louisville Loop to open
thread.title_full: Southwest section of Louisville Loop to open

author: courier-journal.com
title: Southwest section of Louisville Loop to open
text:
A 2.6-mile section of the Louisville Loop in southwest Jefferson County will be opened on Tuesday in a 10 a.m. ceremony at which Mayor Greg Fischer is scheduled to preside.
The Louisville Loop is a paved, shared-use path designed for walkers and bikers that eventually is intended to encircle much of the outer reaches of the county.
The newest section opening is a 2.66-mile section between the Mill Creek station of Louisville Gas & Electric Co. and Riverside, the Farnsley-Moremen Landing. The segment, a 10-foot wide paved pathway safe for bicycle and pedestrian travel, is the first new construction on the Ohio River Levee Trail section of the Louisville Loop since 2008.
Fischer and other dignitaries will have a ceremonial bicycle ride Tuesday morning from a new trailhead at the Mill Creek station, 7600 Watson Lane, to Riverside.
